p: Co-encapsulation of probiotic strains Staphylococcus succinus (MAbB4) and Enterococcus fecium (FIdM3) in alginate (2 g/100 mL) resulted in a significant improvement ( P < 0.05) in the survival of co-encapsulated cells when exposed to acidic (pH 2.0–3.0) and bile (0.3, 0.6 and 0.8 g/100 mL) conditions. Viability was maintained throughout the storage period and ranged from 8.1 log cfu/mL (Colony Forming Unit) to 7.9 log cfu/mL for about a period of 30 days at 4 °C [ 169].
